document.docAuthor: Ferreira, Luciane Augusto De Azevedo & Anker, Arthur
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined .
Panama [ Pacific ]: 1 male , cl 3.3, cw 3.4 ( FLMNH UF 57719 )
,
Azuero Peninsula , north of Búcaro de Tonosí , Puerto Vapor ( Puerto Cañas ), 7°21’41.1”N , 80°21’56.5”W , estuary, outer mudflat, low tide, under dead wood log, leg. P.P.G. Pachelle ,
16.02.2019
(fcn PAN-026); 1 male , cl 2.5, cw 2.4 ( FLMNH UF 57158 )
, Coiba Is.,
Isla Coiba , eastern coast, northern end of Bahía Damas , 7°30’55.5”N , 81°40’23.3”W , depth less than
8 m
, in
Pocillopora
rubble, leg. M. Leray et al. ,
19.02.2019
, (fcn PAN-134); 1 male , cl 3.8, cw 3.7 ( MZUSP 33469 )
,
Río Mar , rocky intertidal exposed at low tide, leg. A. Anker , J.F. Lazarus-Agudelo & T. Kaji ,
20.03.2015
; 3 males , cl 3.7, cw 3.9, cl 3.6, cw 3.6 and cl 3.1, cw 3.5, 2 ov. females, cl 3.5, cw 3.6 and cl 3.0, cw 3.2 ( MZUSP 33449 )
,
same collection data as for previous specimen; 3 males , cl 2.7, cw 2.3, cl 2.8, cw 2.4 and cl 2.0, cw 1.9 ( MZUSP 40070 )
,
Isla Venao , 08°52’48.6”N , 79°35’36.9”W , leg. L.R.L. Simone ,
01.02.2006
; 1 male , cl 4.5, cw 4.1 ( FLMNH UF 57159 )
, Las Perlas Is.,
Isla Contadora , reef near Playa Larga , 8°37’59.4”N , 79°01’52.9”W , under rocks, leg. P. Pachelle & M. Leray ,
22.03.2019
(fcn PP 19-037); 1 female , cl 4.6, cw 4.5 ( FLMNH UF 57160 )
, Las Perlas Is.,
Isla Saboga , 8°37’42.4”N , 79°03’24.4”W , rocky intertidal, under rocks, leg. P.P.G. Pachelle & M. Leray ,
23.03.2019
(fcn PP 19-070)
.

Previous records from Panama
. Glassell (1938) ; Haig (1957b , 1960 , 1962 , 1968 ); Gore & Abele (1976) ; Gore (1982) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 76 .
Petrolisthes zacae Haig, 1968
: A–C, extra-limital specimen, male (cl 4.7 mm, cw 4.2 mm) from Bahía Málaga, Colombia (CRBM-UV-cr:2009-103), dorsal (A), ventral (B) and frontal (C) views [photographs by AA].

FIGURE 77 .
Petrolisthes zacae Haig, 1968
: A, B, extra-limital specimen, female (cl 5.9 mm, cw 6.0 mm) from Bahía Málaga, Colombia (CRBM-UV-cr:2009-103), dorsal (A) and frontal (B) views [photographs by AA].

FIGURE 78 .
Pisidia magdalenensis ( Glassell, 1936 )
: A, male (cl 3.3 mm, cw 3.4 mm) from Azuero Peninsula, Panama (FLM- NH UF 57719), dorsal view [photogragh by AA]; B, female (cl 4.6 mm, cw 4.5 mm) from Las Perlas Islands, Panama (FLMNH UF 57160), dorsal view [photograph courtesy of Paulo P.G. Pachelle].

FIGURE 79 .
Pisidia magdalenensis ( Glassell, 1936 )
: A, extra-limital specimen, female (cl cw indet.) from Bahía Málaga, Colombia (CRBM-UV), dorsal view; B, C, extra-limital specimen, ovigerous female (cl cw indet.) from the same locality (CRBM- UV); D, E, two individuals of unknown sex from Taboga Island, Panama (not deposited), dorsal view [photograghs by AA].

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution . East Pacific: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama (Coiba Is., Bahía Honda in Veraguas , Azuero Peninsula, Isla Venao, Taboga Is., Melones I., vicinity of Ciudad de Panamá , including Amador Causeway, Las Perlas Is.), Colombia , Ecuador and Peru ( Haig 1960 , 1962 ; Gore 1982 ; Moscoso 2012 ; present study).

Ecology . Intertidal and subtidal, known depth range: 0–76 m ; rocky shores and hard or mixed bottoms with coralline algae and coral rubble; among rocks, rubble, polychaete cavities, algae, among hydroids, gorgonians, scleractinian corals (dead and living
Pocillopora
), sometimes associated with holothurians or hermit crabs, e.g.
Petrochirus californiensis Bouvier
( Haig 1960 ; Gore & Abele, 1976 ; Parente & Hendrickx 2000 ; Moscoso 2012 ).

Remarks .
Pisidia magdalenensis
is one of the most abundant porcelain crabs in the tropical eastern Pacific, especially in more offshore conditions ( Gore 1982 ). It is also one of the most variable porcelain crabs in terms of general background colouration and colour pattern ( Figs. 78 , 79 ).
